bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: all terrain vehicle or atv means a wheeled or tracked vehicle propelled by motorized power, and capable of travel on or off a highway, including a motorcycle but not including

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a snowmobile, or
a motor vehicle that is licensed for highway travel under the Motor Vehicle Act;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: electric bicycle means a wheeled device

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on which a person may ride,
with pedals or hand cranks that allow it to be propelled by human power, and
with an electric motor;
a road or trail with a paved surface,
a cross-country or downhill ski route marked in a ski area by the owner of the ski area,
a road used for logging or mining,
a road or trail used for access to fences, power lines, wind generators or communication towers, or
a trail on which there is no vegetation except on a strip that, if present, can be straddled by a 4-wheel vehicle;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: highway has the same meaning as in the Motor Vehicle Act;
hunting has the same meaning as "hunt" in the Act, and includes

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: transporting a hunter,
transporting game, or
transporting equipment, firearms or supplies which are intended for, or in support of, hunting;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: management unit or M.U. means an area designated as a management unit by B.C. Reg. 64/96, the Management Unit Regulation;

motor vehicle means a device in, on or by which a person or thing is being or may be transported or drawn, and which is designed to be self propelled, and includes an atv or snowmobile, but does not include

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a device designed to be moved by human, animal or wind power,
a device designed to be used exclusively on stationary rails or stationary tracks, or
a boat propelled by motorized power;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: motorcycle has the same meaning as in the Motor Vehicle Act;

snowmobile means a vehicle designed primarily for travel on snow or ice, having one or more steering skis, self propelled and using one or more endless belts or tracks driven in contact with the ground.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person commits an offence if the person uses or operates a motor vehicle or electric bicycle in an area described in Schedule 1 during the period specified in that schedule for each area.

A person commits an offence if the person uses or operates a motor vehicle or electric bicycle for the purpose of hunting in an area described in Schedule 2 during the period specified in that schedule for each area.
A person commits an offence if the person uses or operates an atv, electric bicycle or snowmobile in an area described in Schedule 3 during the period specified in that schedule for each area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Atv and snowmobile hunting closed areas
bcl:section.bcl:text: A person commits an offence if the person uses or operates an atv, electric bicycle or snowmobile for the purpose of hunting in an area described in Schedule 4 during the period specified in that schedule for each area.
A person commits an offence if the person uses or operates a snowmobile for the purpose of hunting in an area described in Schedule 5 during the period specified in that schedule for each area.

A person commits an offence if the person uses or operates an atv or electric bicycle for the purpose of hunting in an area described in Schedule 6 during the period specified in that schedule for each area.
A person commits an offence if the person uses or operates a snowmobile in an area described in Schedule 7 during the period specified in that schedule for each area.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Sections 3, 5, 6, and 7, with respect to trapping furbearing animals only, do not apply to a person who is authorized to trap under the Act.
Section 4 does not apply to a person who uses or operates an atv or snowmobile for a commercial purpose, other than hunting, in an area described in section 3 of Schedule 3.
Section 4 does not apply to a person who uses or operates a snowmobile in an area described in section 3 of Schedule 3 during the period December 1 to May 1 inclusive.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 169/2020, App. 5, s. 6.]
Section 2 does not apply to a person who uses or operates a snowmobile, for a purpose other than hunting,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in an area described in sections 37, 38, 42, 75 and 107 to 110 of Schedule 1,
in an area described in section 22 of Schedule 1 during the period December 1 to March 31 inclusive, and
in an area described in section 41 of Schedule 1 during the period November 1 to April 30 inclusive.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 2 does not apply to a person who uses or operates a snowmobile

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in an area described in section 43 of Schedule 1 during the period November 1 to May 31 inclusive,
in an area described in sections 21 and 44 of Schedule 1 during the period December 1 to April 30 inclusive,
in an area described in section 46 of Schedule 1 during the period December 1 to May 31 inclusive,
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 218/2000, s. 2.]
in an area described in section 66, 71, 83, 84, 85 or 115 of Schedule 1, or
in an area described in section 69 (Middlepass Creek) of Schedule 1.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 2 does not apply to a person who uses or operates a motor vehicle, except a snowmobile, for a commercial purpose other than hunting in an area described in section 44 of Schedule 1.
Section 2 does not apply to a person who uses or operates a motor vehicle for industrial forestry purposes in an area described in section 45 of Schedule 1.
Section 2 does not apply to a person who uses or operates a motor vehicle for a commercial purpose other than hunting

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in an area described in section 9 of Schedule 1 and outside of Junction Sheep Range Provincial Park, or
in an area described in section 86, 111 or 117 of Schedule 1.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 2 does not apply to a person who uses or operates a motor vehicle for a commercial purpose in the area described in sections 71 (Finlay) and 133 (Sustut River — Johansen Lake — Moose Valley) of Schedule 1, provided the motor vehicle stays on existing mining and logging roads.

Section 2, with respect to trapping furbearing animals only, does not apply to a person who is authorized to trap under the Act in the areas described in sections 71 (Finlay), 72 (Upper Flathead), 73 (East Flathead), 75 (Baribeau Creek), 80 (Garnet Valley), 89 (Clinton Creek), 107 (Sanca Creek), 108 (Leadville Creek), 109 (Dutch Creek and Brewer Creek) and 133 (Sustut River — Johansen Lake — Moose Valley) of Schedule 1.

Section 2 does not apply to a person who uses or operates a motor vehicle on the industrial road locally known as the Omineca Mining Road from Akier Lake in the south (56 26' 00" N, 125 45' 00" W) to the south shore of the Toodoggone River in the north via Lawyers Pass (57 22' 49" N, 127 15' 03" W) where that road passes above 1 450 m in elevation in the area described in section 71 (Finlay) of Schedule 1.
Section 2 does not apply to a person who uses or operates a motor vehicle or electric bicycle for a commercial purpose other than hunting

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the area described in section 74 of Schedule 1 during the period July 1 to November 30 inclusive, or
in the area described in section 120, 122, 127, 128, 129, 130 or 132 of Schedule 1.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 2 does not apply to a member of the Tŝilhqot'in Nation who uses or operates a motor vehicle or electric bicycle in the area described in section 118 of Schedule 1 in order to access Aboriginal title lands.
Section 2 does not apply to a person who uses or operates a motor vehicle or electric bicycle in the area described in section 118 of Schedule 1 in order to access private property.
Section 2 does not apply to a person who uses or operates a motor vehicle or electric bicycle in the area described in section 23, 119, 120, 122, 127, 128, 129, 130 or 132 of Schedule 1

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on a highway, or
on an industrial road used in order to access private property.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 5 does not apply to a person who uses or operates a snowmobile in an area described in section 2 of Schedule 4 during the period December 1 to May 1 inclusive.

Section 7.1 does not apply to a person who uses or operates a snowmobile for a commercial purpose other than hunting or commercial back country recreation in the area described in sections 9 (Hart Ranges), 10 (Upper Fraser/Quesnel Highlands), 11 (Wells Gray/Thompson), 12 (Revelstoke/Shuswap), 13 (Central Kootenay), 14 (Southeast Kootenay) and 16 (Northern Rockies) of Schedule 7.
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 130/2016, App. 4, s. 1 (f).]

Section 6 does not apply to a person who uses or operates a snowmobile in the areas described in section 3 of Schedule 5 during the period December 16 to March 31 for the purpose of transporting hunters, game, equipment, firearms or supplies to or from a place where there is wildlife.

thence in a general southwesterly and southerly direction along the midline of Bonanza Creek and a prolongation thereof to the point of intersection with the northerly boundary of the watershed of Eldorado Creek; thence in a general easterly, southerly and southwesterly direction along the northerly, easterly and southerly boundaries of the watershed of Eldorado Creek to the point of intersection with the easterly boundary of the watershed of Gun Creek; thence southwesterly in a straight line to the point of commencement.
